website_summaries.verdict: This high-quality springform pan is slightly taller than other brands, giving even more room for sweet, creamy goodness.
pros: Can be hand-washed with mild detergent
Available in 7 and 9 inches, but only 7-inch size fits in Instant Pot

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE: Counterfeit alert
customer_reviews.text: This product is listed as "Nordic Ware Leakproof Springform Pan, 10 Cup, 9 Inch," however, it is listed as made by "Aluminum." If you click on the link it takes you to other "Aluminum" products, not Nordic Ware. (Note: I did not notice this subtlety at the time of purchase. The first pan I ordered arrived bent, so I returned it for a replacement. The replacement was not damaged; however, it is certainly not NORDIC WARE...It leaks and is a waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Gallaher

customer_reviews.title: Leaked the very first time!!!
customer_reviews.text: I never give bad reviews but i am VERY disappointed - I made a baked frittata that I have made dozens of times in my old european springform pan (which really is leakproof) and the egg mixture came out the bottom and effectively GLUED the pan and rim together. It took an hour of soaking in hot water just to get them apart, and bits of the hardened egg is stubbornly refusing to come off the pan which means this springform will be even more leaky than it already is. This should be labeled leak-resistant, leakproof is just plain misleading.
customer_reviews.author: DaisyH

customer_reviews.title: Excellent !!! The best for CheeseCake
customer_reviews.text: Wow! It is amazing spring form pan! I can make a delicious and beautiful cheesecake! I made it for my husband birthday! Here is the proof of it! I attached some pictures
customer_reviews.author: MARIA GABRIELA ROA

customer_reviews.title: NOT LEAK PROOF
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice pan but it is NOT LEAK PROOF! You cannot stick this pan in a water bath in your oven for the perfectly cooked cheesecake. The pan itself lets water in. I do like the pan itself, but I will still have to wrap the whole thing in foil before baking in a water bath.
customer_reviews.author: Jessy M.

customer_reviews.title: Lovely pan, No leakage
customer_reviews.text: These springform pan's are pretty popular with pot heads, Instant Pot heads that is. I finally succumbed to the lure of the cheesecake and purchased one. It fits great in my 6 qt Duo. The pieces fit securely together and there is no leakage. The spring is secure but not so strong it is hard to open or close. As long as you prep the pan properly there is no damage to your cake when you release the spring. I grease and flour mine. I am very happy with this purchase and can wholeheartedly recommend this pan.
customer_reviews.author: Judi W

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend buying it
customer_reviews.text: The spring form rusted after two uses. I would not recommend buying it. Nordic Ware claims on their website "We warrant your Nordic Ware product to be free of defects in materials and workmanship for a specified period of 5/10/15/ or 20 years after the original date of purchase (please consult the original product packaging to determine which warranty applies). " Their mission statement includes "We strive to offer attentive service that exceeds our customers' expectations." They did not approve a return through Amazon within 6 months from the purchase. Very disappointed in the company.
customer_reviews.author: Zsuzsa Horvath

customer_reviews.title: rusts first time you clean it
customer_reviews.text: hard to believe this is really a decent brand and the reviews are real. it rust the first time i washed it before I ever got to use it. don't waste your money. buy one elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: angie jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Rust after less than 4 hours
customer_reviews.text: Received this today. Hand washed with a soft sponge and dried and there is already rust forming and scratches on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Pan To Make Life Easier In Baking
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best 7 inch springform pan that I have ever used. I made a cherry cheesecake in pressure cooker in 20 minutes and it turned out perfect! I returned today to order 2 more pans for making multiple cheesecakes. Since it only takes 20 minutes to cook in pressure I can have a variety made in no time. When cooled it comes out of the springform pan very easily. All I did was flip on 2 small breakfast plates and topped with my husbands favorite fruit topping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You would think Nordic Ware is good stuff. Think again.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's leakproof. Worked fine for making cheesecake, except when I cut the cheesecake on the pan. First, I use parchment paper on the bottom and I didn't use cutting strokes, as I did not want to slice the non-stick coating. I used a butter knife and just pushed through. The bottom pan is so thin and weak, that there are indentions on the pan now. I have never had this happen with any other pan. Why don't they make good stuff anymore. I'm really tired of all the crap company's make now a days.
customer_reviews.author: Eric G.

customer_reviews.title: Complete and Utter Failure
customer_reviews.text: An absolutely terrible product. I bought this to finally up my baking game and make a proper cheesecake. The very first use of this pan ended in complete failure. It definitely was not leak proof and after only an hour and a half in the oven the bottom had completely warped cracking my crust and causing the sides to leak. I was astonished that it was made so poorly.
customer_reviews.author: Aggort

customer_reviews.title: Teflon coating peeling off
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this pan for 11 months , and in that time I’ve used it less than a dozen times. Recently the coating has been peeling off inside the pan . I’ve always treated it gently, and I don’t use a dishwasher so I’m not sure why this is happening. Just poor quality I guess, very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: S. Beach

customer_reviews.title: Test for leaks before use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this "leakproof" springform pan for my instant pot. I was did my research and found good reviews for this pan. I attempted to make a cheese cake and it was completely watered down. I assumed I must of made an error or needed to completely cover in foil (top was covered as directed). Well today I finally attempted to make breakfast casserole in my instant pot. Once again it was full of water I even covered top and bottom with aluminum foil. So much for research. I hand washed the pan and noticed it leaks from the bottom. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: David G.

customer_reviews.title: Made in CHINA!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought all Nordic Ware was made in the USA, that's why i bought this pan. Surprise...this one is made in CHINA!! I'll keep it but and very disappointed that NOWHERE on the description of this item is that disclosed! C'MOM AMAZON....start posting the CORRECT INFORMATION on items!!! How about a section devoted to strictly AMERICAN MADE??????
customer_reviews.author: jilliebean

customer_reviews.title: after 4,5 times making cheese cake coating started to peel
customer_reviews.text: I've used many baking pans from Nordic Ware, maybe their quality standard is going down.... After using for 3 months, maybe 4,5 times to make cheese cake and gently hand washing, inner coating started to peel off. I am going to look for other brand now. Expected to last me longer than this......
customer_reviews.author: roor

customer_reviews.title: I read cooks illustrated pretty heavily. I like having the best of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I read cooks illustrated pretty heavily. I like having the best of the best. The best spring form pan according to cooks illustrated was the Williams and sonoma gold touch one...and it's $50! Cooks illustrated named this the 2nd best spring form pan (it was pretty close to Williams sonoma) And it's SUCH a better price. I opted for this one to save a good chunk of money, and boy am I glad I did! This pan is great!!! So happy with my decision. It makes your cheesecakes look perfect and professional for a very affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: brittany

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 2 months ago. I have made approximately 5 things in this pan, cakes and cheesecakes. After the 4th, the non-stick coating began to peel (see photos). Also, as for the leakproof part, let me say what I think they mean. It doesn't leak OUT of the pan when you put batter into it. However, when using a bain marie for cheesecake, it DOES NOT keep the water out of the pan. I continued to wrap the pan in foil. This last time, the foil leaked and got into the cake, showing me that it is not leak proof from outside fluid. I will spend the money for a solid aluminum pan or steel pan.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Latch Rusts
customer_reviews.text: I'd be thrilled if it wasn't for the fact that the latch mechanism is rusting after the first use, despite washing and drying by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Lupo Roma

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great cheesecake in the Instant Pot!
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought an Instant Pot and joined a facebook page where everyone was discussing their Instant Pot cheesecakes. Having a teenager who loves cheesecake, I decided to buy this Springform Pan because it fits perfectly in my Instant Pot. This pan is well designed and sturdy. It is easy to use and washes off well. I have made over 6 cheesecakes since getting it arrives and it still looks brand new!
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: 5 star for a month then 1 star.
customer_reviews.text: The first 30 days this was a 5 star product, amazing deal. Then 3 months later it is 1 star, junk. Not sure if mine was a bad batch but this is what happened: Used probably 5-7 times max and the anti-stick layer recently started peeling off in pieces (all sizes). Interestingly it does not happen on the bottom but it does on the side as if they were done with different processes. Unfortunately that make it basically unusable: you risk eating big chunks of teflon/paint or whatever it is. After few bakes that is a real bad product (unless again this was a bad batch). So you save few dollars and risk very bad GI diseases...
customer_reviews.author: bluebird

customer_reviews.title: My first Springform pan.
customer_reviews.text: I like this pan. I’ve never used a springform pan before. The first time I used it, there was no leaking. The second time I used it to make the same exact thing and it leaked some. Not a ton but enough that I had to put something underneath of it to catch the drips. Third time, same thing. I will still continue to use it, I just wish it didn’t leak. I made a Lemon Meringue Cheesecake each time. So I don’t know if I was doing something wrong, or if it was the pan, or the recipe, or what.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Cheesecake in an Instant Pot, you will need this.
customer_reviews.text: Very cute when you pull it out of the box. Haven't made any cheesecake in the Instant Pot yet, but looking forward to Easter, will make a Key Lime cheesecake then. Like the Nordic Ware 6-cup bundt pan I got also, it won't leave a lot of dessert around. I'd say these two would be a four serving size for my husband and me, which is fine. We usually have other couples over for meals, so that fits in perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: beenthere

customer_reviews.title: "Leak-proof" spring form pan. Hmmmmmm!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not going to lie, I was pretty excited when I read that this spring form pan was going to be leak proof. The day I received the pan- I was ready to make some good ol fashioned flan. After preparing everything for the flan, I put all the ingredients in the magical "leak-proof" spring form pan and set the flan in the oven. Later on, maybe like 3 minutes later, I go to check on the flan and noticed it's leaking!!! Bruhhhhhhhh. I'm disappointed to say the least, but hey, I got another spring form pan I can hopefully use for some other cooking venture I decide to embark on.
customer_reviews.author: The detriments yt

customer_reviews.title: Better than my expensive one
customer_reviews.text: I've got a really nice springform someone got me a few years ago from Williams Sonoma that I love. Needed another pan because I volunteered to make some cakes for a party. Bought this because it was cheap and I was in a rush. Used it and I was blown out of the water, it was better than my WS. Works great, SUPER easy to clean, and comes off like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was dishwasher safe
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that it's not dishwasher safe, but otherwise worked fine. The enclosed directions say to spray with cooking spray and flour before using. Instead, I did spray with cooking spray and then lined it with parchment paper. I could have probably just gone with one or the other, but I saw all the reviews about the sides sticking and got paranoid. It was fine. No leaks, BUT I did wrap the bottom in foil as a precaution. Didn't leak. I do like that it seems to be heavier gauge metal than my old Mirro pan (which lasted many years). I expect this to last many years as well, especially with (yuck) hand washing.
customer_reviews.author: Drumlin

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this item.
customer_reviews.text: I did a pre-use leak test. I put enough water to just cover the bottom of the inside of the pan. it leaks! I also did a pre-use test of an empty pan sitting in some water, it still leaks! DO NOT BUY THIS PAN!
customer_reviews.author: kat

customer_reviews.title: High hopes—dashed.
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY trust this brand. It got high marks from ATK. I WANTED to love this; but no. The spring form does not close tightly enough around either base (see pic: light coming through closed pan). This means 1) baking must be done on sheet pan and 2) cake will leak out of pan during baking (see pic: leaked cake batter stuck on sheet pan). Should have gone for an alternative. Not sure that itwill now get much use.
customer_reviews.author: Worm Doc

customer_reviews.title: Delivers
customer_reviews.text: We originally ordered the smaller one and our inability to estimate size forced us to buy the bigger one to actually use. Our biggest questions in using this vs bread shaped bins or the glass baking trays (for brownies) we customarily used was how the taste would change with different. We’ve used this brand’s baking trays and they have been durable and solid. This was easy to take apart, easy to clean and did a great job with all items we have used it on. We didn’t have to adjust cooking times much and a leaves really enjoyable texture with the food.
customer_reviews.author: O.G.

customer_reviews.title: Never buy another cake pan
customer_reviews.text: I know that these types of pans are nothing new but I will never buy another one. This one is too perfect. Its nonstick, it cleans well (stick it right in dishwasher), and it cooks more evenly than any other pan I have used. I have used my first one over and over now for over two years and not once has it leaked... at all. In fact I don't think I have ever had even a slight problem with it. I have two and I'm obsessed with them. The perfect pan.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Nice size, but it isnt leak proof.
customer_reviews.text: Second pan purchased , I returned the first as it leaked lije a sieve..and the second one still leaks...though not as bad as the first. I use this both in a convection oven and in a pressure cooker. Leaks appear round seams and around bottom. The fit is not tight around the collar.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Knutson

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great
customer_reviews.text: Our teenage grandson wanted a pie-cake for his birthday. My strange and fun husband decided to make one. He purchased 3 premade pies, put them in this cake pan with one mixed cake mix. This pan worked like a charm. The cake cooked with the pie in the middle. There was no leakage or mess at all. We had fun with this handy pan. I bet used as intended will be just as successful!
customer_reviews.author: GMA

customer_reviews.title: Looks very well made and sturdy. We used it to make a cheesecake the ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks very well made and sturdy. We used it to make a cheesecake the first time around, and it worked flawlessly. HOWEVER, the second time around, the mix started leaking from the pan (where the latch is) before we even put it in the oven (at least we lucked out there). I checked and double checked that it was secured properly, as I've encountered a leaky mess with a springform of a different brand before. I expected more from this product, and I'm very disappointed. Will have to go through the hassle of returning it now.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS LOR

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use - No Leaking!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a springform pan in the past and it always leaked, so I was skeptical. But, after watching a couple of youtube videos on springform pans and reading through product reviews, I finally settled on buying this one. Finally, I got to try it out on an Almond Flour cake recipe and it worked like a charm. It was easy to use and there was no leaking! Now, to be on the safe side, I hand-washed it and keep it stored in the original box in my pantry so it never gets bent out of shape, but so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Kay D

customer_reviews.title: Works great, excellent Instant Pot cheesecakes!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make cheesecakes in my Instant Pot. Absolutely no complaints. It seals tight at the bottom; the hinge seems sturdy through 6 months of use. Just used the pan numerous times in the lead up to Christmas to make gift cheesecakes instead of cookies. Worked fantastic with a piece of parchment paper on the bottom to easily remove from pan. My only complaint is that it allows me to make cheesecakes way too easily, which probably isn't great for my waistline.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Garner

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PAN!
customer_reviews.text: My very first cheesecake and perfection! Caramel cheesecake! Just read and followed directions! Just made my 3rd cheesecake, no runs, no drips, no errors! Great pan! UPDATE! I have made 3 cheesecakes now, no runs, no drips, no errors! I always thought cheesecake was hard to make. It's not! I use vanilla wafers instead of graham crackers for the crust. I just like that better and the kitchenaid 5 cup chopper gets the job done! Turns them into crumbs in no time! Love this pan!
customer_reviews.author: Debie

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS NOT LEAK PROOF!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I were SO excited to finally have a nice cheesecake pan. Made a cheesecake last night and it leaked! Cheesecakes are made to be cooked in water baths. Even with foiled wrapped around the bottoms as a precaution water SOAKED our cheesecake. The description is very misleading...so disappointing...
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Not leakproof at all
customer_reviews.text: You know how it says it's "leakproof" ya well that's very far from the truth. Made a pecan pie and it leaked extremely bad. It was shipped fast and everything but very unhappy with this product looks like I bought a new dog dish
customer_reviews.author: Bret

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: I like this much better than the other mini springform pan I previously bought. The springform part slides easily and it did not leak my cheesecake batter--though it may possibly leak with other batters, or water may be able to get in if you sit it in water to bake. Now that I have two mini-pans, I guess I could stack them and steam two in my pressure cooker at once, but the whole point in making a mini cheesecake is NOT to have that giant cheesecake calling out to be eaten (figuratively speaking).
customer_reviews.author: CindyTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Love this Pan!!!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not 100% leak proof, but I own 2 of these pans and going to purchase more. They are my absolute favorite to make my cheesecakes in. The lip is high enough that it makes removing the cheesecake a breeze, and they stack nicely in the fridge during the cooling step. This is my absolute go to spring form pan for cheesecake making and I always recommend them to others looking to dabble in the art of cheesecakery!!
customer_reviews.author: Seth Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality Pan
customer_reviews.text: This pan is very nice quality. It does not leak out of the bottom or side, but you might notice a little "weeping" through the bottom into the bottom tray. I haven't noticed a lot and it doesn't seem to get worse, so I still give it 5 stars. The non-stick coating is good. This is NOT made in America like some of Nordic Wares other products. However, it is a nice quality pan.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price....
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this for using it with my instant pot. I wanted something non stick and this was the perfect choice. It is made well and fit in my 6 qt IP perfectly. Our first attempt at making IP cheesecake and it came out pretty good. I definitely recommend this one for IP users.
customer_reviews.author: princesspinto

customer_reviews.title: Nordic Ware Makes Some of The Best Baking Items
customer_reviews.text: I now own several Nordic Ware baking items. From what I've found, they are one of the top brands in the field. I have zero complaints with anything I've purchased. They're all made very solid, nothing flimsy or cheap. I'm about spending more money up front on things that will last and everything I've purchased from Nordic Ware lives up to standard. You can't go wrong with this company or this pan.
customer_reviews.author: Keagan

customer_reviews.title: Handy little pan. 7 inch cheesecake is just the right size.
customer_reviews.text: This is truly non-stick. I use it to make cheesecake in my slow cooker and all I have to do id wipe it out with a soapy sponge. Hint: instead of wrapping the pan in foil (which is difficult and doesn't always seal it) I bought disposable aluminum cake pans ($1.00/2) and molded them to fit the pan. They last indefinitely.
customer_reviews.author: JENNERIN

customer_reviews.title: Teflon Coating Coming Off On Cheesecake
customer_reviews.text: The Teflon or paint or whatever on the inside is coming off after about 10 uses.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Dowie

customer_reviews.title: Good product, fair price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on Amazon reviews. Considering some models I saw in physical stores, this one is clearly better than others of similar price, and even superior to some ones above $20. It is well built, has a nice finish, a good touch, and looks fine. Others $12 springform pans I saw were far worse, and some of them woould clearly leak, as the parts didn't fit very well. In short, a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.L.

customer_reviews.title: Actually leakproof
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter when she told me cheesecake would result from owning one. Indeed, that has proven to be the case. So I also bought a new bathroom scale...but that's beside the point. Last time she used the pan, it somehow got immersed in water that was not supposed to come in contact with it (cheesecake-making involves alchemy, I am certain) but both she and I rejoiced to discover that the pan's leakproof qualities meant that the cheesecake remained un-moistened by the wayward water. Huzzah!
customer_reviews.author: D. Foster

customer_reviews.title: No spillage in oven and easy to clean / use
customer_reviews.text: I have used this pan 3x, for cheesecake, sweet potato pie as well as baking a cake since I do not have a cake pan and everytime it did not leak onto my oven. I still add the foil to the bottom and check after to make sure it is really leak proof and so far only very minor leaking with the pie but that is mainly due to the fact that I should use a cake pan instead. Very good product
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: I Wannabe a Cake Master
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to bake Mark Bittman’s Lemon Almond Butter Cake for a social distancing picnic in Central Park so I ordered this 9” springform cake pan. On my first try, this pan worked perfectly! No leaking, no sticking, easy to pop off the sides and slide the cake into my portable cake container! My friends were oohing and aahing over my cake and ate every last crumb! My second cake was King Arthur Flour’s easy Chocolate Cake. It looked and tasted impressive! Either I have a knack for baking or this pan makes it so easy! I’m thinking of buying another pan to experiment with layer cakes now!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for most things.
customer_reviews.text: I had no problem with thicker based cakes or custards with a crust, However I had severe leaking (all over the oven) of a thinner base, about the consistency of milk, I would use parchment up the sides, to prevent leakage. However, I am not sure if that was the pans fault or mine. So I only deducted one star.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Not a true 7 inch pan
customer_reviews.text: I just received my springform pan and it’s not a true 7 inch pan. It measures 6.5 inches. I had also ordered a set of 3 springform pans from another company which included a 7 inch pan. That set has a true 7 inch pan. Pictures are attached.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good overall, arrived dented
customer_reviews.text: Arrived dented, but still functional. Worked fine in my 8quart instant pot. The raised bottom makes it super easy to remove a cheesecake and plate it separately. However, if you decide not to plate it separately, the raised bottom of this pan does not make an attractive serving dish. Overall pleased with a purchase for myself for my pressure cooker, but wouldn't buy as a gift due to the denting. Note to all those who say it's not leak proof-- no springform pan is EVER perfectly leak proof. Placing any springform pan in a water bath without foil will ALWAYS leak. However, a springform pan should not leak batter OUT, and this one does not. Good pan overall.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: It’s not bad but not great either.
customer_reviews.text: To keep things short: 1. This cake mold leaks! Do not try to do water bath with this pan. I was foolish to thing this pan has good quality. My baking session ended up with a wet sponge cake because this mold doesn’t have a good deal. 2. The heat doesn’t seem to distribute evenly with this pan. I would recommend to find another pan that uses better metal alloy than this “non-stick” surface treatment. It doesn’t work that well for baking anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Chen

customer_reviews.title: Not leakproof
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what incantation, dance, or secret handshake it takes to make this leakproof so mine leaks. Could have saved money buying a cheaper one since I’m still gonna have to wrap it for recipes requiring water baths. Not sure what to do for those recipes that don’t have a crust.
customer_reviews.author: InsertNameHere

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job.
customer_reviews.text: Average. This is my first springfoam pan, it let's water in (even with foil) so be aware of that if you are trying to make a cheesecake in a water bath. I saw a suggestion online to sit the pan in an oven bag, that will be my solution. It cleans easy. Does it's job. Just not an earth shattering pan that I would absolutely need to buy again, I would try out others to try and find a better seal.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna S

customer_reviews.title: IT LEAKS!
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice nonstick pan and easy to remove your cake but BUYER BEWARE-- it's definitely NOT leakproof as stated. Thick batter will stay put but butter from the graham crust of my cheesecake leaked out in the oven making a smoky disgusting mess! I'd recommend placing on top of a baking sheet in the oven or consider a different pan.
customer_reviews.author: az_mom

customer_reviews.title: Well made product
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product over and over in my 6-quart Instant Pot. It is wonderful! Well-made, easy to clean, sturdy. I've used it for banana breads, cheesecakes, brownies, mashed sweet potato casserole, and on and on. Great product. I would not recommend a springform pan for a liquidy batter, but it works great with thicker batter recipes.
customer_reviews.author: becolorado

customer_reviews.title: Great pan
customer_reviews.text: Really like this pan, but I have never had a Nordic Ware Pan that I didn't like and that was not of the highest quality. Have some pretty old Nordic bundt pans and they are all still like new and will last forever if taken care of. I only give Nordic Ware pans as gifts, as well. Really like the interchangeable bottoms. Have only used the fluted bottom so far and cake comes out great and looks really nice. Also, no leakage as with some other springform pans.
customer_reviews.author: Dora2

customer_reviews.title: I guess it’s not a good quality pan.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I am so disappointed in this pan. I used it twice. Who knows why but the second time I used it, the bottom is now dented all around the outer perimeter. The springform sides got perfectly so it’s not as if I had to force it and it dented. But the outer perimeter of the bottom of this pan is now dented. What a huge disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Very nice; sensible design
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that I've never had anything leak when using my old springform pan but I can see how it might. But my old one was old and I wanted a new one and bought this. The design does seem to be sensible. Not sure why all springform pans are not designed this way. Anyway, I'm happy, it was a worthwhile purchase, and if something were ever to leak --- it won't in this pan.
customer_reviews.author: Clutter Hater

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful results as promised
customer_reviews.text: Great pan! I recently purchased this because I was making a dessert to take to a party and didn't want to leave the bottom of the springform pan with it...I never get them back! So I did spray it with Pam and put a parchment circle in there, prepared the cookie crumb crust and Mousse as usual. It performed beautifully! Slipped right off the bottom flawlessly. I really like this pan and am glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: SusieQ

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend for cheese cakes
customer_reviews.text: This was a very good purchase to make a ricotta cheese cake. No leaking. Prior to use I poured water in the pan to check for leaking. None. Sprayed and dusted the pan prior to adding mixture. Placed on a cookie sheet, “just in case” it leaked while baking. It did not. Spring openings work great. After cooling, cake released easily, no sticking.
customer_reviews.author: MotherofMims

customer_reviews.title: Works great, good size
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make small NY style cheesecakes and Italian Easter pie/basket cake. This did not leak, but I always cover the bottom of a springform pan in foil and sit it on a rimmed baking sheet just in case. It is sturdier than the typical cheap aluminum springform pan.
customer_reviews.author: All Day Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good valu
customer_reviews.text: This pan fits perfectly into my instapot, which is why I got it. It did not leak for my cheesecake during cooking but when it cooled, there was definitely some butter that leaked out from the crust at the bottom. It wasn't a ton, but I wasn't expecting any and so the reusable bags I put it in got dirty.
customer_reviews.author: ZHastings

customer_reviews.title: Eh... not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: First off, other reviews had said that this was not 9 inches. It most definitely WAS. The size was exactly as advertised. However, the pan had a large dent in the side upon opening package. Shipping box was undamaged, so had to have happened before it was shipped. In that condition it would definitely NOT be leak-proof. Had to return the item and will probably not bother trying again. Seemed no better quality than the springform I already own, which was about 1/2 the price.
customer_reviews.author: trisha

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart
customer_reviews.text: This was really a piece of junk. I used it once and when I picked it up after the contents were cooked it fell apart. Part of the contents were salvaged, but most ended up on the counter and ultimately in the trash. I washed the pan and tried to put it back together several times but it kept falling apart. The pan ended up in the trash with most of my ruined dinner.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Coffman

customer_reviews.title: Make a smaller cheesecake.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 9 inch springform pan I use to make cheesecakes. I got this 7 inch model to make a smaller cheesecake. For the 9 inch pan I use four 8oz packages of cream cheese and four eggs. And it serves a large party. For the 7 inch pan I tried cutting the recipe in half. Two 8oz packages and two eggs and half the sugar. And it worked great. And I can now just make one for the family. Happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard E Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Great Pan, doesn't leak
customer_reviews.text: I love this pan. I've made a few types of keto cheesecake (some have been pretty runny! and this pan has been the best addition to my cabinets. I don't worry about it leaking or anything like that. Makes baking and serving easy.
customer_reviews.author: Abby123

customer_reviews.title: Truly doesn't leak
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made spring-form pan. I used it for crustless cheesecake. It released perfectly. No leakage. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Island

customer_reviews.title: Leaks but works if you have a liner and thick batter
customer_reviews.text: It leaks water straight out of the box. I tried reseating the spring foam pan and doing and clamp down but that didn’t fix it leaking.
customer_reviews.author: Millissa

customer_reviews.title: Not leak proof
customer_reviews.text: The main reason for purchasing this was for use in my instant pot. I was hoping to not only do desserts, but quiche and steam vegetables. I am giving two stars because it is not leak-proof like it claims to be. I will not be trying egg in this because it will just run out. Disappointing. I placed peas and carrot sticks inside to steam for my baby and that worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Only used a few times and it is nice and leak proof
customer_reviews.text: Only used a few times and it is nice and leak proof. I put water in to let it soak and was curious if I would have to line it and no water spilled out. Pretty impressive for a Springfield pan. Most can't hold a seal. The reason I gave it a 4 star though is I'm concerned about how long it will hold up. When it was don't baking there was a dent in it where there wasn't before. I lightly ran a finger over it and it popped out. Only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: it leaks like a sieve
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this pan as i use springform pans all the time. However, it leaks like crazy and i have to line it with parchment and cover the bottom with foil. On top of that, if any food is on the pan, it sticks!
customer_reviews.author: Sleepless

customer_reviews.title: Very good pan, but like most others, not leak proof
customer_reviews.text: A bit of coffee cake leaked out before it started baking around the edges, so I'll put a pan under next time. Dark pans bake darker, so I will need a light-colored one as well. Didn't know that when I ordered this.
customer_reviews.author: RKParkinson

customer_reviews.title: Rim was dented...Great Return Service from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I wanted: great simple style, good brand, nice uniform non-stick coating...until I got it and the top rim was dented. Due to the nature of the order, I couldn't exchange it, only return. Luckily Amazon made it super simple and I was relieved that I didn't have to put in any effort. They scheduled a UPS pick-up after I logged in and clicked the return option under My Orders. I wrapped in the original packaging and left it on my doorstep for "Brown." I will order another because Nordic IS the best and this combo of springform pan with bundt bottom was too perfect for my baking needs :)
customer_reviews.author: Crystal E

customer_reviews.title: Leaks at clip line.
customer_reviews.text: the pan is inferior made. There is a gap because of the clip. The edge of the bottom ring has bump from the metal overlapping itself. It leaks like a sieve and the join line of the ring where the clips is.
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little pan! I have used it for several cheesecakes and had no issues with leaking! It bakes evenly and perfect and I am glad that I purchased it! I have tried many other fancier brands of pans and this one hands down is just as good if not better! I especially appreciate that unlike most spring form pans, the design of this is such that there is no "lip" around the edge of the bottom part of the pan, so after you take the ring off, it makes serving whatever you have made a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: Jami

customer_reviews.title: The pan worked great in my Instant Pot the first time I made ...
customer_reviews.text: The pan worked great in my Instant Pot the first time I made a cheesecake. The second time, I took out the finished cake and the bottom began to leak. There was a dent in the pan and along the bottom. It happened while the pan was inside the Instant Pot. Very disappointed. I have lots of Nordic Ware and this is the first time I've ever had an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Did it’s job but not leak proof
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from r my instapot to bake a cheesecake. The first time I made the cake the crust was wet from the pan not being leak proof. The next time I 100% covered the bottom of the pan in heavy foil and that seemed to help. Did it’s job but not leak proof.
customer_reviews.author: Az4Angela

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife and she's very happy with it. I'm also very happy with the cheese cakes she's made in our Instant Pot. Things don't stick much and it hasn't rusted at all. Cheese cakes pop right out.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Pigwillow

customer_reviews.title: incorrect size
customer_reviews.text: The dimensions on this product are incorrect. It is not 3.13 inches deep. It is less than 2 3/4" deep. I already had 2 that size and was looking for a much deeper pan. I was quite disappointed with the product but not with Amazon. They took it back and paid the return postage.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara L. Peck

customer_reviews.title: Leaky
customer_reviews.text: I returned another brand that leaked and ordered this one. It leaks I think all Springform pans leaks.
customer_reviews.author: mlsturgeon

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I used this pan to make two cheesecakes. Both turned out well. There may have been a minute amount of leaking, but not enough to matter to me or make a mess. After the cheesecake set, the springform came off with no issues and the cheesecakes were perfect. I cooked one in a waterbath, and the other was just in the oven. The one in the waterbath turned out a little bit better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holds Less Than Traditional 9-in Springform
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pan to replace an old one, and while I really like it and can tell that it's high quality, it holds less than my previous 9-inch springform. The bottom of the pan is slightly elevated (I assume to make a more leakproof seal) so this takes away a little space. The same cheesecake recipes I made in the past are no longer fitting because of the size difference, but the inconvenience is minor. Other than that, I've had no issues with baking and removing cakes from it! So far, it's been leakproof as promised, but I've been using tin foil either way just to make sure. Happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie R

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for insta- pot. Just my husband and I. Larger cake is too rich, so this size best
customer_reviews.author: Ruth North

customer_reviews.title: Not leak proof
customer_reviews.text: The pan works very well and is completely non stick. I have been using this for 3 months now but I wouldn’t call it leak proof. Is use this for an egg frittata in an instant pot and the liquid egg does seep out some what. Cleaning can be an issue as the egg seeps into the rolled steel crevices and can make cleanup a nightmare
customer_reviews.author: Craige

customer_reviews.title: Not leak proof
customer_reviews.text: I fastened it both ways - right-handed and left-handed. Left-handed is a no-go, but right-handed can be used with a thick dough. Look at the pictures - it is a see-through. The barcode on the packaging took me to the original Nordic Ware website. I also have to give credit to retailer for solving my issues very fast and efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: tasmokot

customer_reviews.title: It rusts after a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: I've used it 4 times and it's started to rust. Now it's useless and going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Tyrrin

customer_reviews.title: Came bent and leaky
customer_reviews.text: This arrived with a dent in it. When that happens it is impossible to make it leak proof because the shape is different from the bottom disk. The quality control should be better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality cookware
customer_reviews.text: This is the best-rated springform pan. Haven't used it to bake with yet. Took it apart and washed it in the dishwasher upon arrival. Will bake a recipe in it very soon. It's very well made and I have great expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: Coating flaking off on inside of pan
customer_reviews.text: This pan was wonderful for the first 10 months of use but now the coating is flaking off on the inside. It is also starting to lose its non-stick capability. I have never put this pan in the dishwasher and always washed it by hand. It was very easy to clean. I have used it for baking cheese cakes and have never had a problem with leaks. I am really disappointed as now I am afraid that the coating will leech into whatever I bake in it. I would not recommend at all.
customer_reviews.author: Geri Phares

customer_reviews.title: Pick another pan
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy piece of junk. Used it once and it bent and wouldn’t hold shape
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Not Leakproof
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed that this springform pan leaks like a sieve. And, the extended sized base will make it difficult to cover it with foil to keep the water bath from leaking in as well as contents leaking out. I fit the form, itself, both "upside up and upside down" into the base and hoped that the click when it seated would form the seal. It did not form a seal. I ordered this particular springform pan based on the "Best Buy" information from a much-respected tv cookery show. Maybe Nordic Ware has changed the style on this pan since this tv show's cookery book of 15 seasons of reviews was published last year.
customer_reviews.author: GrammyKay

customer_reviews.title: Leaky pan with a hastily taped label
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a damaged and retaped label, and pan was slightly dented. Figured that would all be cosmetic if it washed up ok, and immediately found that it wasn't leakproof. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C.

customer_reviews.title: loved the width of my cake
customer_reviews.text: Made my cheesecake, even tiramisu in this one, loved the width of my cake, it looked a lot more professional than what it used to look in other 9 inch standard sized baking tin. There are no spills, so I never put any foil around, as some of the buyers said. I was apprehensive about buying 7 inch, but for a small family of 2 people plus 2-3 guests can be served nicely with this sized cake. The 9inch cake used to be way to big for 2 of us to finish and I hate overeating by either of us.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Get This For Your Instant Pot!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 6qt Instant Pot. Used this to make cheesecake which turned out fantastic! I've tried other springform pans & this one is the best & makes for the prettiest cakes! It's leak proof & well made - made in Germany. Fits perfectly in the 6qt pot. Definitely a must for Instant Pot fans!
customer_reviews.author: hammy sandwich

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t leak!
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived, it had a dent in the rim. But it fits together fine. I didn’t have time to send it back and wait for another with the holidays.
customer_reviews.author: Di

customer_reviews.title: Solid sides dont flex like silicone,  protecting your crust!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use in instant pot - their springform pan has silicone sides, which "squish" and can lead to collapsed side crust. Used today in a water bath. Set pan inside a secured crock pot liner, so no leaks. My cheesecake is so pretty ! Next one will be in instant pot.
customer_reviews.author: Wise 24153

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: I tested the assertion that this springform pan is leakproof and it failed. I put water and it is leaking, which means I have to find a way to insulate it when I make cheesecake.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Product is 9.75” across (not 9.12”)
customer_reviews.text: Received this item today. Had purchased with the intent of using in my 8 quart Instant Pot. Product description indicates it is 9.12” across, it is actually 9.75” across (including bottom plate) as such it will not fit in my Instant Pot.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Best for cheese cake
customer_reviews.text: Overall I can only say that I have used this pan for cheesecake and so far I am very impressed! I love that I can slide my cheese cake directly off the pan now. I would probably not bake cake batter in this pan. If you are looking for a quality cheesecake spring form pan this is the one to get!
customer_reviews.author: tiffanymyang

product_meta.title: Nordic Ware Leakproof Springform Pan, 7 Inch, Charcoal
product_meta.description: Size:7 Inch| Style Name:Leakproof Springform PanThis Professional Weight Formed Metal Bakeware Is A Wonderful Addition To Any Kitchen. Non-Stick Coated, It Allows For Easy-Release And Effortless Clean Up. Designed For Cheesecakes And Other Desserts The Smooth Locking Mechanism And Tight Seal Make This Pan Simple To Use. Reliable And Long Lasting.
feature_bullets: Nonstick coating for easy food release and cleanup
Leak-proof tight seal prevents messy spills
4-cup springform pan for cheesecakes and other desserts

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,975 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
